snippet: Since President Obama swept into office with vast backing from young people, a new corps of voters have come of age with views shaped by the recession.
abstract: Nation's first-time voters, unlike their counterparts in the millennial generation who showed high levels of enthusiasm for Mr. Obama, are less enthusiastic about him and significantly more likely to identify as themselves as conservative; their views are shaped largely by the recession and many cite a growing lack of faith in government in general.

byline.contributor: Robbie Brown contributed reporting from Atlanta, and Malia Wollan from San Francisco. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Since President Obama swept into office with vast backing from young people, a new corps of voters have come of age with views shaped by the recession.

headline.seo: Economy Cuts Into Obama’s Youth Support
headline.main: Stung by Recession, Young Voters Shed Image as Obama Brigade
headline.print_headline: Stung by Recession, Young Voters Shed Image as Obama Brigade
